page.title: 06LISSINGTON AREA: ATTITUDES
page.content: Everyone seems to enjoy living here.A few mothers feel if the villages were a little larger there would be more friends for their children within safe walking or cycling distances. Some older people would like street lights.Cars have made people less dependent on the village & probably contributed to a decline in community spirit.The only meeting place is the Pub & this is used by a minority. All are realistic that villages of this size can not support any amenities. People feel that the uprooting of hedgerows has gone too far & are particularly saddened by the removal of roadside hedges. General opinion re straw burning was whilst there is no practical alternative it is a most unfortunate necessity. Strength of feeling varied considerably.
